alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 03 at 3:02AM PST until January 04 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. Wind prone locations along US-395 from Susanville to the Nevada state line and in the Surprise Valley may see gusts 70 to 80 mph. Sheltered areas may only see gusts of 25 to 35 mph. * WHERE...Surprise Valley California, Lassen-Eastern Plumas- Eastern Sierra Counties and Northern Washoe County. * WHEN...From 9 AM Monday to 7 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Very rough air for aviation interests. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will occur in western and northern Lassen County, in the Surprise Valley and north of Gerlach, as well as for Plumas and Sierra counties. Travel impacts are expected above 5000 feet along Highways 36, 44, 49, and 89. Total snow accumulation of 1 to 4 inches above 4500 feet, with 4 to 8 inches in the higher terrain west of Susanville and near and west of Highway 89. Blowing snow may reduce visibilities.
info.instruction: Now is the time to secure loose outdoor items such as patio furniture, holiday decorations, and trash cans before winds increase which could blow these items away. Prepare ahead of time by making sure you have extra food and water on hand, flashlights with spare batteries and/or candles in the event of a power outage. Check CALTRANS and/or NDOT for any travel restrictions due to snow or wind before venturing out.

area.areaDesc: Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California
